result.execSummary:
The defendant Deon Montrell Bean was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens. No positive results. No illegal drugs. Maintain absolute sobriety. No controlled substances without valid prescription. No contact with drug community.
Seek and maintain full time employment. May be part time if enrolled in school. Obtain high school diploma or GED. Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample  if not already done. Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons. Civil rights suspended until reinstated.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deon Montrell Bean

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deon Montrell Bean in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle E. Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 17 days time served, Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.   Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.

The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months with the following conditions:
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.  May be part time if enrolled in school.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample  if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.
Defendant Deon Montrell Bean in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin (for ADA Hauer).  Plea hearing scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deon Montrell Bean in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Step Nolten for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.  
The Court ordered no use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
